meanings.definition: In a manner full of hate or malice.
meanings.sent1: She glared hatefully at her rival during the competition.
meanings.sent2: He spoke hatefully about his former boss after being fired.
meanings.sent3: The cat hissed hatefully at the vacuum cleaner, thinking it was a threat.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered hatefully in the sky, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: The villain laughed hatefully as he revealed his evil plan to the hero.

meanings.definition: Showing or feeling intense or passionate dislike.
meanings.sent1: The teacher gave a hatefully difficult exam to the students.
meanings.sent2: The dog growled hatefully at the mailman approaching the house.
meanings.sent3: The toddler looked hatefully at the broccoli on his plate, wishing it would disappear.
meanings.sent4: The old house stood hatefully abandoned, with broken windows and overgrown weeds.
meanings.sent5: Her eyes burned hatefully with jealousy as she watched her ex-boyfriend with his new girlfriend.
